name: ITP-239-CIV-HOP-Stormwater Drainage Pits-Headwalls Supply and Installation
template name: ITP-239-CIV-HOP-Stormwater Drainage Pits-Headwalls Supply and Installation Rev 2

name: Document Title: ITP-238-CIV-HOP-Stormwater Drainage Pits Supply and Installation
ITP Description: HOP-Stormwater Drainage Pits Supply and Installation
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Acceptance Criteria - Precast steel reinforced concrete drainage pits shall be manufactured, supplied and installed in accordance with Section 705.07 & 705.09
○ All concrete shall be manufactured to the concrete mix design registered by VicRoads and comply with the requirements of Section 705.04. Concrete grades shall comply with Table 705.041
Acceptance Criteria - Precast headwalls shall be manufactured, supplied and installed in accordance with Sections 701, 703, 610 and relevant standard drawings as per the IFC package
2.5 - Cast in Place Drainage Pit / Headwall
Acceptance Criteria - Cast in place drainage pits shall be constructed in accordance with the requirements of Section 705.06 and at the locations and to the dimensions shown on the drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Step irons shall be manufactured by 13mm steel bar covered with polypropylene plastic in accordance with 705.04
○ Drainage pits greater than 1.0 m deep shall be fitted with step irons in accordance with Section 705.12
Acceptance Criteria - Subcontractor ITP shall conform with the IFC Drawings & Relevant Standards & Specifications..
Frequency - Each Lot (in case undertaken by subcontractor)
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
Acceptance Criteria - Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate the plan location, height and line of pits in accordance with design documentation and 701.10
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation shall be to the depth indicated on the design documentation. Precast pits must have a clearance of 400mm from excavation face and external face of pit.
Acceptance Criteria - Bedding conforming to to 710.09 shallbe supplied, placed and compacted to a thickness:

Acceptance Criteria - All connections shall be finished to provide a smooth surface, uniform with the inner of the pit structure. Saw cut surrounding hole shall not exceed 50mm greater than the pipe diameter.
○ Exposed reinforcement shall be coated with an approved epoxy treatment
Acceptance Criteria - Pit floors are smoothly shaped from inlet to outlet for a height one third the diameter of the outlet pipe.

Acceptance Criteria - Drainage pits greater than 1.0m deep shall be fitted with step irons in accordance with AS 1657. Ladder rungs shall not obstruct openings and that water does not discharge on them.
Acceptance Criteria - Frames for drainage pit covers shall be cast in place or or bedded on fresh mortar, 5mm thick, consisting of 2 parts sand and 1 part cement.
○ Height shall be within 10mm of the design level
Acceptance Criteria - Backfilling around drainage pits shall be placed in layers not exceeding 300mm loose thickness and compacted to refusal

Acceptance Criteria - The location of each run of underground drainage shall be verified by a survey certificate prior to backfilling the culverts and shall be recorded progressively on the Contractor’s as constructed drawings
○ Unless specified otherwise the tolerance on location of pipes compared to the design or a change to the design notified in accordance with this clause shall be:
(a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of  kerbs or barriers ±20 mm
(b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers ±100 mm
(c) invert level of pipes at pits ±50 mm
(d) departure from design grade of pipe runs ±10 mm in 10 m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250

Acceptance Criteria - All drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of earthworks to subgrade level and prior to construction of pavement layers, by an independent testing organisation using closed circuit television (CCTV) to verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
